title: 1985년 United States v. Wendell Cole, Howard Masters, B.K. Taylor, Larry Masters, Defendants 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. Wendell Cole, Howard Masters, B.K. Taylor, Larry Masters, Defendants. 판결일: 1985-03-19. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Wendell COLE, Howard Masters, B.K. Taylor, Larry Masters, Defendants-Appellants
**판결일**: 1985-03-19
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Hancock, Hatchett, Kravitch

## 변호인

G. Russell Petersen, Vero Beach, Fla., defendant-appellant H. Masters., Bruce Wilkinson, Stuart, Fla., for defendants-appellants B.K. Taylor and L. Masters., Robyn J. Hermann, Asst. Federal Public Defender, Miami, Fla., for defendant-appellant W. Cole., Samuel J. Smargon, Linda C. Hertz, Sonia Escobio O’Donnell, Asst. U.S. Attys., Miami, Fla., for plaintiff-appellee.

## 인용

- 755 F.2d 748

## 판결문 요약

755 F.2d 748
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Wendell COLE, Howard Masters, B.K. Taylor, Larry Masters,Defendants- Appellants.
    No. 82-5455.
    United States Court of Appeals,Eleventh Circuit.
    March 19, 1985.
    
      G. Russell Petersen, Vero Beach, Fla., defendant-appellant H. Masters.
      Bruce Wilkinson, Stuart, Fla., for defendants-appellants B.K. Taylor and L. Masters.
      Robyn J. Hermann, Asst. Federal Public Defender, Miami, Fla., for defendant-appellant W. Cole.
      Samuel J. Smargon, Linda C. Hertz, Sonia Escobio O'Donnell, Asst. U.S. Attys., Miami, Fla., for plaintiff-appellee.
      Appeals from the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida.
      Before KRAVITCH and HATCHETT, Circuit Judges, and HANCOCK*, District Judge.
      HATCHETT, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      In this criminal drug case, we review the district court's order entering judgment against appellants.  We affirm.
    
    Facts
    
      2
      Sometime between October, 1977, and July, 1981, Donald Raulerson organized a marijuana smuggling operation.  As a result, Raulerson imported more than 500,000 pounds of marijuana and earned over $100 million dollars.  Although a large number of co-conspirators are involved in this case, for purposes of this appeal we review the convictions of Wendell Cole, Howard Masters, Larry Masters, and B.K. Taylor.
    
    
      3
      Early in the enterprise, Raulerson recruited Jose Pena and ins...
